Docs.param: the format string, as described in android.text.format.DateFormat
Docs.summary: Given a format string and a time in milliseconds since Jan 1, 1970 GMT, returns a CharSequence containing the requested date.

MemberSignature.Value: public static string GetBestDateTimePattern (Java.Util.Locale locale, string skeleton);
.method public static hidebysig string GetBestDateTimePattern(class Java.Util.Locale locale, string skeleton) cil managed
static member GetBestDateTimePattern : Java.Util.Locale * string -> string

Docs.param: the locale into which the skeleton should be localized
Docs.summary: Returns the best possible localized form of the given skeleton for the given locale.
Docs.returns: a string pattern suitable for use with java.text.SimpleDateFormat.

remarks.para: Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public static hidebysig class Java.Text.DateFormat GetDateFormat(class Android.Content.Context context) cil managed

Docs.summary: Returns a java.text.DateFormat object that can format the date in short form according to the context's locale.
Docs.returns: the java.text.DateFormat object that properly formats the date.

remarks.para: Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public static hidebysig char[] GetDateFormatOrder(class Android.Content.Context context) cil managed

Docs.summary: Gets the current date format stored as a char array.

remarks.para: Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public static hidebysig class Java.Text.DateFormat GetLongDateFormat(class Android.Content.Context context) cil managed

Docs.summary: Returns a java.text.DateFormat object that can format the date in long form (such as Monday, January 3, 2000) for the context's locale.
Docs.returns: the java.text.DateFormat object that formats the date in long form.

remarks.para: Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public static hidebysig class Java.Text.DateFormat GetMediumDateFormat(class Android.Content.Context context) cil managed

Docs.summary: Returns a java.text.DateFormat object that can format the date in medium form (such as Jan 3, 2000) for the context's locale.
Docs.returns: the java.text.DateFormat object that formats the date in long form.

remarks.para: Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public static hidebysig class Java.Text.DateFormat GetTimeFormat(class Android.Content.Context context) cil managed

Docs.summary: Returns a java.text.DateFormat object that can format the time according to the context's locale and the user's 12-/24-hour clock preference.
Docs.returns: the java.text.DateFormat object that properly formats the time.

remarks.para: Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public static hidebysig bool Is24HourFormat(class Android.Content.Context context) cil managed

Docs.param: the context to use for the content resolver
Docs.summary: Returns true if times should be formatted as 24 hour times, false if times should be formatted as 12 hour (AM/PM) times.
Docs.returns: true if 24 hour time format is selected, false otherwise.
